text: Megan Clarke was raped on a night out in
Manchester last July she'd been drinking
when she met 19 year old Ricardo
Rodriguez fortes Gomez he was found
guilty and jailed last month for six
years at the trial the judge Lindsay
Kushner said women were entitled to
drink themselves into the ground but
their disinhibited behavior could put
them in danger and that led some to
accuse her of blaming the victim rather
than the attacker now Megan Clarke has
waived her right to anonymity to speak
exclusively to me about the case I think
she was absolutely right in what she
said but it was taken out of context she
she put the blame us of Leon rapists not
the victims she just simply said and to
be careful basically which is his smart
advice we need to be careful but she
would she wasn't at all victim blaming
and she went on to say a woman will be
less likely to report a rape quote
because she was drunk or cannot remember
what happened or feels ashamed to deal
with it or if push comes to shove a girl
who's been drunk is less likely to be
believed than one who was sober at the
time it's not how you felt at the time
yeah that's definitely true what you
didn't think you would report something
like that because you've had a few
drinks yeah definitely it's not the way
it should be but that was the point it's
that is the harsh reality that's how
things are Megan Clarke also recounted
how difficult she found giving evidence
in court
it was it was really difficult I've
managed to I didn't it didn't bother me
so much in like the months before it I
managed to just you know push it to the
back of my mind and ignore it but then
obviously I couldn't once once the trial
started and then it started to really
bother me and when I had to give
evidence in court that was it was
horrific it was really really difficult
especially due to seeing their footage
of it immediately before give them
evidence what is your message to other
women when they're out and about with
their mates in the summer having had a
few drinks
don't live in fear of rapists and being
in danger
look after yourself of course know that
it's not it's not it's not your fault
whatever happens just and that I guess
I'd still encourage people to report it
because you know you have a better
chance even though you feel if it ever
happened to you again god forbid you
wouldn't report it yeah I don't think I
would from the experience I've had
